IndexPage.mainTitle: Survey of Self-assessment of the Digital Maturity of Digital Public Services (DPS) for SMEs
IndexPage.description1: This survey is a comprehensive assessment of the digital maturity level of your organisation, government agency, or business.
IndexPage.description2: The answers to this survey will allow you to assess the current stage of your digital development at multiple levels, highlight the main challenges your organisation is currently facing, and provide targeted recommendations for addressing them. These recommendations will serve as a foundation for planning further steps aimed at enhancing service availability and increasing your organisation's competitiveness in the digital landscape.
IndexPage.description3: The survey 1 on digital maturity of public services for SMEs is intended to be filled up by the government officials. The questions comprised to follow five key digital maturity criteria (ESCAP, 2025). In its pilot version, it is also focused on three sectors: healthcare, education, and disaster risk reduction. It includes 45 multiple-choice questions and takes approximately 10 minutes to complete.
IndexPage.description4: The survey 2 is on self-assessment for representatives of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) is following four digital maturity criteria of SMEs in their digital transformation journey, it  includes 21 multiple-choice questions. The average completion time is around 5 minutes.
IndexPage.invitationText: If you are a civil servant or SME, please click the respective button below.
IndexPage.projectInfo_preLink: The survey was prepared as part of the UNESCAP project "
IndexPage.projectInfo_linkText: Strengthening the policy and regulatory framework of digital public services for small and medium enterprises (SMEs) in North and Central Asia in support of the Asia-Pacific Information Superhighway (APIS) Action Plan 2022-2026
IndexPage.projectInfo_postLink: ", implemented with the support of the Russian Federation.
IndexPage.roundtableInfoText: The results of this survey will be presented as part of the Regional Roundtable on Digital Public Services for Small and Medium-sized Enterprises, which will be held on August 26-27, 2025, in St. Petersburg, Russian Federation. More detailed information is available here:
